intro: Exacum lawii, commonly known as the Christmas star or star of Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its compact, evergreen shrub form. The plant produces clusters of small, star-shaped flowers in shades of white, pink, and purple, typically blooming from late winter to early spring. Exacum lawii thrives in bright, indirect light and well-draining soil, making it a popular choice for indoor gardening. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its ability to bloom year-round under proper care.
